result.execSummary:
The defendant Macklin J Dion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution payable to Richard and Crystal E. for $13,890.98 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. 
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol. Unless medically assisted treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.
No contact with the victim(s) or victim's residence without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: The Petition for Sentence Adjustment is DENIED.  sdg
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Carl Ashley, Br. 33, for review. spc
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (28 pages) commencing APRIL 15, 2015 received and filed. kl

Defendant Macklin J Dion in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Macklin J Dion in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Crystal E. and Richard E.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 40 MONTHS, with credit for 91 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 25 MONTHS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.
* No contact with the victim(s) or victim's residence without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* Restitution payable to Richard and Crystal E. for $13,890.98 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Case is adjourned from 4/1/2015 to 4/15/2015 for sentencing in br. 6 per defense.  lms

Defendant Macklin J Dion in court with attorney Cynthia Mercedes Wynn.  Defendant Macklin J Dion in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS. Defendant Macklin J Dion in court with attorney Cynthia Mercedes Wynn.  Defendant Macklin J Dion in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Deputy court clerk: LMS.

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in br. 6.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Review hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Macklin J Dion in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 7/9/2014 at 1:30pm.  lms

Case adjourned to 07-29-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Status Conference.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.

Defendant Macklin J Dion in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Macklin J Dion in custody.  Dax C Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Macklin J Dion not in court.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant appeared 4-3-14 on the scheduled initial appearance date and told the baliff he was recently released from the hospital and his physician said he was to come back to the hospital. Court held case open to 4-4-14 and the Defendant was given a reminder slip. Based on non appearance the Court issues a warrant. 
 Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 04-04-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Megan L. Morrisey in court.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant did appear in the courtroom on 4/3/14 but became ill after going through the metal detector. The defendant contacted his Physician who wanted him to be seen in his office asap. Court adjourned the case for an initial appearance.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-3-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
